item.title: 克罗地亚总理表示，升级后不急于出售外国债券
item.description: 克罗地亚总理安德烈-普兰科维奇（Andrej Plenkovic）表示，尽管最近信用评级有所改善，但克罗地亚没有计划加快在国际市场上出售债券。【原文：Croatia has no plans to accelerate its bond sales on international markets despite recent improvement in credit ratings, according to Prime Minister Andrej Plenkovic.】

item.title: 希腊将以高达 7.27 亿欧元的价格出售 NBG 10%的股份
item.description: 希腊正在出售希腊国家银行 10% 的股份，这是私有化行动的一部分，在过去的一年里，希腊从贷款机构中退出。【原文：Greece is selling a 10% stake in National Bank of Greece as a part of a privatization drive that has seen the state exiting from lenders in the past year.】

item.title: 施普林格-自然》杂志在德国的首次公开募股定价约为区间的中间值
item.description: 学术出版商施普林格-自然公司（Springer Nature）的首次公开募股定价将在目标区间的中段左右，这可能是德国今年第二大首次公开募股，为欧洲股票资本市场的反弹添砖加瓦。【原文：Academic publisher Springer Nature’s initial public offering is set to price at around the middle of its targeted range in what could be Germany’s second-biggest IPO this year, adding to the rebound in Europe’s equity capital markets.】

item.title: 中国政府警告英伟达，中国人工智能芯片龙头飙升 20% 上限
item.description: 中国人工智能芯片制造商汇川技术公司（Cambricon Technologies Corp.【原文：Chinese AI chipmaker Cambricon Technologies Corp. soared its 20% daily limit on Monday, leading a sector rally after Bloomberg News reported Beijing was stepping up pressure on domestic companies to ditch Nvidia Corp. processors for local alternatives.】

item.title: 应用营养公司宣布首次公开募股计划，助力伦敦发展
item.description: 应用营养有限公司（Applied Nutrition Ltd.）正在考虑在伦敦进行首次公开募股，这可能会对英国遭受重创的资本市场起到推动作用。【原文：Applied Nutrition Ltd. is considering an initial public offering in London, in what could be a boost for the UK’s bruised capital markets.】

item.title: 津巴布韦黄金支持的 ZiG 在贬值后走弱
item.description: 津巴布韦黄金支持的货币在 9 月 27 日贬值 43% 后，周一开盘兑美元汇率略微走低。【原文：Zimbabwe’s gold-backed currency opened slightly weaker against the dollar on Monday after a 43% devaluation on Sept. 27.】

item.title: 阿斯顿-马丁因供应链问题和中国市场疲软下调业绩展望
item.description: 阿斯顿-马丁拉贡达全球控股公司（Aston Martin Lagonda Global Holdings Plc）下调了对今年业绩的预测，这家跑车制造商将原因归咎于供应链中断和中国需求疲软。【原文：Aston Martin Lagonda Global Holdings Plc is lowering its prediction for the year with the sports-car maker blaming supply chain disruptions and weak demand in China.】

item.title: 南非股市有望延续创纪录涨势
item.description: 南非股市在第三季度创下了 11 年来最强劲的表现，投资者认为涨势还将继续。【原文：South African stocks are having their strongest third quarter for 11 years and investors see the gains extending.】

item.title: 胃口大增，CME 交易所新增锂合约
item.description: 芝加哥期货交易所运营商将推出一种锂材料的新合约，因为在需求增加和市场大幅波动的情况下，电池金属的交易流动性也在增加。【原文：The operator of Chicago’s futures exchange will roll out new contracts for a type of lithium material, as trading liquidity grows for battery metals amid heightened demand and massive market volatility.】

item.title: 如果竞争对手出现，MBK 可能会考虑提高对韩国锌业的出价
item.description: 私募股权公司 MBK Partners 的一位高层表示，如果有竞争对手收购这家全球最大的精炼锌和铅生产商，MBK Partners 愿意考虑以更高的报价收购韩国锌业公司的控制权。【原文：MBK Partners is open to considering a higher offer to take control of Korea Zinc Co. if rival suitors for the world’s biggest producer of refined zinc and lead emerge, a top executive of the private equity firm said.】

item.title: 盛宝以商业环境变化为由关闭香港办事处
item.description: 交易平台盛宝银行（Saxo Bank A/S）发表声明称，由于 "商业环境瞬息万变"，该行将关闭在香港的办事处。【原文：Saxo Bank A/S, a trading platform, is closing its office in Hong Kong because of the “rapidly changing business landscape,” according to a statement.】

item.title: 富时 100 指数直播：英镑走高，GDP 和住房数据先行
中国玉米因刺激措施和进口下降而大涨
item.description: 由于中国政府采取了一系列刺激措施，提振了需求复苏的预期，中国玉米期货创下八个多月来的最大涨幅。【原文：China’s corn futures rose the most in more than eight months thanks to a series of stimulus measures from Beijing that has boosted expectations for a demand recovery.】

item.title: 僵尸油轮满载石油驶入中国北方港口
item.description: 悬挂新加坡国旗的 "EM Longevity "号油轮在海上航行二十多年后，于近三年前完成了最后一次航行。本月早些时候，船舶跟踪数据显示它已抵达中国港口，满载原油准备卸货。【原文：Singapore-flagged oil tanker EM Longevity made its final voyage almost three years ago, after more than two decades at sea. Earlier this month, ship-tracking data showed it arriving at a Chinese port, loaded with crude and ready to discharge.】

item.title: 前甘伏石油公司高管因刚果贿赂面临瑞士审判
item.description: 贡渥集团（Gunvor Group）的一名前高管因涉嫌受贿而在周一受审，日内瓦最大的石油交易公司之一以及瑞士对大宗商品公司有争议的轻触式监管成为焦点。【原文：A former executive at Gunvor Group stands trial for bribery on Monday, throwing the spotlight on one of Geneva’s biggest oil-trading firms and Switzerland’s controversial light-touch regulation of commodity houses.】

item.title: 贸易前景改善，林吉特有望创下历史最佳季度业绩
item.description: 由于中国最近的刺激措施提振了东南亚国家的贸易前景，马来西亚林吉特将创下历史最佳季度。【原文：The Malaysian ringgit is set to cap its best quarter on record as China’s recent stimulus measures boost the Southeast Asian country’s trade outlook.】

item.description:

item.title: 大众汽车第二次盈利预警揭示汽车制造商的衰落之路
item.description: 大众汽车公司三个月来的第二次利润预警明确了一件事：这家欧洲最大的汽车制造商正在走下坡路。【原文：Volkswagen AG’s second profit warning in three months makes one thing clear: Europe’s biggest automaker is in decline.】

item.title: 自 2023 年 2 月以来中国汽车制造商在欧洲销售的电动汽车数量最少
item.description: 中国制造商向欧洲客户售出的电动汽车数量是 18 个月来最少的，8 月份的注册量比去年同期下降了近一半。【原文：Chinese manufacturers sold the fewest electric cars in 18 months to customers across Europe, with registrations falling by nearly half in August from a year earlier.】

item.title: 希尔豪斯正在洽谈为杜威奇交易提供约 2.5 亿美元的贷款
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，总部位于亚洲的资产管理公司 Hillhouse Investment 正在与一个银行财团谈判，以获得约 2.5 亿美元的贷款，支持其收购德威国际学校。【原文：Asia-based asset manager Hillhouse Investment is in talks with a consortium of banks for a loan of about $250 million to back its acquisition of Dulwich College International’s schools, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 隆巴欧迪抛售全部中国资产配置，不买反弹行情
item.description: Michael Strobaek 于 11 月加入 Lombard Odier 担任首席投资官，他的第一个重大举措就是出售为私人客户管理的所有中国股票和债券。【原文：When Michael Strobaek joined Lombard Odier as chief investment officer in November, one of his first big moves was to sell all the China stocks and bonds in its holdings managed for private clients.】

item.title: 日本大选在即，石破茂将退伍军人选入内阁
item.description: 日本下任首相石破茂（Shigeru Ishiba）将任命党内资深人士担任内阁高级职务，他将广泛追求经济、货币和外交政策的连续性，并为预计提前举行的大选做准备。【原文：Japan’s next prime minister, Shigeru Ishiba, is set to name party veterans to senior posts in his cabinet as he broadly pursues continuity in economic, monetary and foreign policy, and prepares for an expected early general election.】

item.title: 海伦飓风导致家禽养殖厂停产，山核桃树受损
item.description: 由于洪水淹没了美国南部，飓风 "海伦 "导致鸡肉加工厂停产，一些鸡群严重受损，山核桃树被冲倒，棉花作物被压扁。【原文：Hurricane Helene has halted chicken processing plants and caused severe damage to some flocks, while also downing pecan trees and flattening cotton crops, as floodwaters swamped the southern US.】

item.title: 韩国称已满足加入全球债券指数的所有条件
item.description: 韩国财政部长崔相木（Choi Sang-mok）表示，韩国已经满足了被纳入一个重要的全球债务指数所需的所有条件，这为下周做出可能刺激数十亿美元资金流入韩国的决定提供了理由。【原文：South Korea has met all conditions needed to be included in a key global debt index, Finance Minister Choi Sang-mok said, making the case for a decision next week that could spur billions of dollars of inflows into the country.】

item.title: 前新加坡石油大亨林氏将向清算人支付 35 亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，林翁权（Lim Oon Kuin）倒闭的石油贸易帝国的清算人将从这位倒下的大亨及其子女那里收回约 35 亿美元，以结束新加坡的民事诉讼。【原文：The liquidators of Lim Oon Kuin’s collapsed oil trading empire are set to recover about $3.5 billion from the fallen tycoon and his children in order to end a Singapore civil lawsuit, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 中国主权债券下跌，刺激政策助推股票押注
item.description: 中国 10 年期主权债券下跌，创十年来最大单周跌幅，原因是投资者预期大规模刺激政策将重振经济增长，从而转向风险资产。【原文：China’s 10-year sovereign bonds fell, extending their biggest weekly drop in a decade, as investors pivoted toward risk assets on expectations a widespread stimulus blitz will revive economic growth.】

item.title: 石破意外获胜，日元兑美元汇率大涨后走低
item.description: 随着市场对石破茂在执政党自民党领导层竞选中获胜的震惊逐渐消退，日元下跌。【原文：The yen fell as the market’s shock subsided over Shigeru Ishiba’s victory in the leadership race of the ruling Liberal Democratic Party.】

item.title: 中国股市创 2015 年以来最大涨幅，即将步入牛市
item.description: 中国股市延续了历史上最引人注目的转折之一，连续第九天飙升，因为政府的刺激政策吸引投资者重返全球最疲软的市场之一。【原文：Chinese stocks extended one of their most remarkable turnarounds in history, soaring for a ninth straight day as government stimulus entices investors back to one of the most beaten-down markets worldwide.】
